Comments_List: You learn all about physical processes that affect human occupation sites and other cool science things, like how to use a GPR
The field experiment kind of flopped, but that wasn't particularly the class's fault.

For a humanities person the amount of science in this isn't terrible. Great class to take if you're interested in archaeology, especially if you've ever been curious about experimental archaeology and why soil does weird things sometimes.
